aboutlunga.firstline: In the year 2000 LungA Art festival was held for the first time.
aboutlunga.para1: It’s an intimate art festival where creativity, arts and culture are celebrated with workshops, lectures and events. The festival goes off with a bang in a culmination of exhibitions and concerts that take place over the final weekend.
aboutlunga.para2: LungA has earned quite the reputation, both locally and internationally, for its great ambiance, good-quality workshops and the fantastic enthusiasm of the participants year on year. Furthermore, the festival has fostered joy, self-knowledge, new lovers, new friends and warm memories to those who come to participate in it.
aboutlunga.para3: The LungA “family” now consists of both the yearly art festival and the LungA school. These are separately run projects but they share the same name, values and ideology.
aboutlunga.themeintro: This year's theme would have been:
aboutlunga.themeheadline: Why we do what we do – cause and effect
aboutlunga.themepara1: In this years’ theme, we aim to explore what drives our own behavior, and to challenge ourselves to see how conscious we really are of what we do and why we do it. What role do our personalities play, in contrast to the social cues and conditioning we receive from our culture? What could these different forms of conditioning look like, and what would a different starting point lead to?
aboutlunga.themepara2: We need to learn to understand ourselves, in order to practice empathy and better understand the actions of others. In today’s tense socio-political atmosphere, it is key to cultivate empathy while remaining aware of our own bias and staying open to the notion that our own narratives and conditions may not be universal – and thus, just like us, those who disagree with us also base their differing views on their experiences and backgrounds. It is this gap in understanding that creates a sense of threat when we disagree, and we have the opportunity to take responsibility for our own awareness.
aboutlunga.themepara3: Societal pressure also directly correlates to our mental wellbeing. What roles do our constructive and destructive behaviors play in our mental health? What about the other way around? What do we learn about e.g. addiction from this point of view?
aboutlunga.themepara4: The goal is to first expand our awareness on what drives our own behavior, and in doing so, awaken our independent, critical thinking skills. Are we making the decisions we really want to, or are we repeating a script ‘programmed’ in us by our surroundings? From there, the highest pursuit of the theme is to begin to view others with this same openness and curiosity.
aboutlunga.lastline: We hope to see as many of you as possible at LungA this year.

workshops.firstline: LungA offers 5 workshops total this year!
workshops.tba: Workshops will be announced in June 2021 – applications for the workshops will open then as well.
workshops.onlineinfo: Included in the price is the workshop, accommodation, three meals a day and a ticket to the final LungA concert.
workshops.childreninfo: Children’s workshop will be announced later.
workshops.generalinfo: As there are no longer any restrictions, we offer participants a roof over their heads and space for a sleeping bag. Contact sessa@lunga.is for more info!

lungalab.firstline: LungA LAB is what we call our informative experimental laboratory.
lungalab.para1: Each year we choose a theme. This year it is “Behaviour” and then we dig into that theme from many different perspectives, through workshop work, talks, various performances, movie screening, panel discussions and so on.
lungalab.para2: This is LungA’s way to contribute to the awareness of social responsibility on individual and collective level, in hope to effect and inspire those involved to take action and be more open towards the diversity of others in general.
lungalab.sponsors: LungA LAB is made in collaboration with Erasmus+, Kaospilot, Hyper Island, University of Brighton, Myndlistarskóli Reykjavíkur.

youthexchange.firstline: Over the last decade we have offered a youth exchange program in collaboration with ERASMUS+.
youthexchange.para1: For the first time since 2019, the Youth Exchange programme will take place at LungA 2022! Stay tuned for more information about the theme and nature of the project this year.
youthexchange.para2: The Youth Exchange groups that have been participating the last years came from the Kaospilot school in Denmark, University of Brighton in England, Hyper Island in Sweden and the Reykjavik School of Visual Arts in Iceland.
youthexchange.para3: The discourse was based upon the collaboration of smaller groups, which includes panel discussions, exercises and a variety of lively inputs.

eventindex.para1: LungA offers a range of international events for the entire duration of the festival – they are all open and free of charge, with the only exception being the final concerts.
eventindex.tba: We're still working on the events of the summer 2022, stay tuned for updates!

shop.firstinfo: We finally went through our archives and here below is everything we have left
shop.para1: Terms and conditions: Orders are sent with Íslandspóstur. The terms of delivery, warranty and transport of Íslandspóstur apply to the delivery of the product.
shop.newcollectioninfo: Our new merch is for sale here – we miss LungA!
shop.archiveinfo: here is our entire archive from the last ten years for sale
shop.info1: This is LungA, about LungA, from LungA, to LungA for more than 20 years.
shop.info2: Each year young Icelanders and gests from afar flock to Seyðisfjörður; creating, experiencing, enjoying, researching, and learning. The festival has become an essential part in the Icelandic art scene as one of the most energetic events of the Icelandic summer. Through words and images, graphic designers Gréta Þorkelsdóttir and Guðmundur Úlfarsson have compiled the colorful history of the festival into this beautiful publication.
shop.info3: Through hundreds of photographs documenting the energy during the festival, and written words by Jónas Reynir Gunnarsson, Fríða Ísberg, Marteinn Sindri Jónsson and Björt Sigfinnsdóttir the book gives a cross section of LungA as we know it.
shop.info4: The book is 288 pages and was published by LungA in 300 numbered copies in the summer of 2021.
shop.quote: No one creates the zeitgeist apart from the young. It is their job to create the future, and each generation must create their form. You cannot make the perfect chair, because people change the way they sit.
shop.name: Goddur
